required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rapid Development and Implementation of a Remote ECG-monitored Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial During a Pandemic: Hydroxychloroquine Prophylaxis in COVID-19 Household Contacts
clinical_study.official_title: Rapid Development and Implementation of a Remote ECG-monitored Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial During a Pandemic: Hydroxychloroquine Prophylaxis in COVID-19 Household Contacts

brief_summary.textblock:
- organizing an entirely no in-person contact clinical trial is feasible during a 22 COVID-19 pandemic 23
- Remote smartphone 6-lead ECG monitoring is possible even in a group unfamiliar 24 with the technology 25
- Hydroxychloroquine used prophylactically at 200 mg BID had no observable 26 cardiotoxicity 27
- Additional study using this technique is warranted to look at reliability and cost-28 effectiveness

detailed_description.textblock: Household members were contacted by telephone and provided consent forms via E-mail electronic signatures. Randomization was 2:1 to HCQ 200 mg BID or observation for 10 days with total follow-up of 14 days. COVID status was determined by home saliva PCR assay on days 1 and 14. Study drug was shipped to participants. Data of daily symptoms and 6-lead ECGs using a smartphone KardiaMobileÂ® 6L application were collected.

primary_outcome.measure: COVID-19 symptom development with positive PCR test
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint was development of COVID-19 symptoms with a positive coronavirus PCR test by Day 14.

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive coronavirus PCR test without symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Development of a positive coronavirus PCR test without symptoms by Day 14
hospital admission for COVID-19 symptoms by Day 14
Death due to COVID-19 within 14 days of study entry
All-cause discontinuation of study medication or study withdrawal by Day 14

secondary_outcome.measure: Symptom severity at specified time points
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at Day 7 and at Day 14 from study entry
secondary_outcome.description: overall symptom severity at Day 7 and Day 14
household attack rate at study entry
documentation of EKG changes such as QTc prolongation on HCQ compared with no drug therapy

arm_group.description: Randomization was 2:1 to HCQ 200 mg BID for 10 days

intervention.description: Randomization was 2:1 to HCQ 200 mg BID or 41 observation for 10 days
